revised_title: Dr. Wallis's Critique on Mr. Hobbes's Book
tldr: Dr. Wallis critiques Mr. Hobbes's book, arguing against his views on Euclidean geometry and mathematical definitions. Wallis disputes Hobbes's claims that points and lines should have some magnitude and that angles of contact should be considered crooked lines. He also addresses Hobbes's duplication of the cube demonstration and other mathematical concepts.
